ik2ZEnmrGDXic7VWSkvMOA.text: Omg!!! The food here is amazing! I've had fried rice at most Thai places and this is by far the best I've had! It wasn't a busy at all when my friend and I came by for a late lunch and the staff was friendly and very efficient. Our food was out within minutes of ordering. The atmosphere is pretty chill and it was very comfortable. Music wasn't too loud and although the setting is pretty open and the location is small, on the other side of the room, you could have a more intimate lunch or dinner. I can see it getting really tight in there during busy hours but with food and great service like that I wouldn't mind. I'll definitely be back soon. And just an FYI, I like spicy food and I got my rice as a four and my lips are still burning. Lol. One last thing, you can make your order as custom as you want my friend wanted no onions and peanuts and they made her order to her liking.

Nkf3cknikAm8ypfHVcxpOQ.text: Normally if I'm in the area, I'll head to Thai Taste, but I figured it's a new year, so let's try something new: Enter Rai Lay (and, yes, I know they aren't exactly new any longer).  The first challenge is finding a place to park. Sure, they have spots right in front, but there are like three of them. Usually there are a couple open spots, but they are there for electric cars, and I don't drive one of those. So after figuring out this issue, we headed inside.  Rai Lay is definitely a change from most Thai places - to start, it's a bit more modern. Nothing wrong with that, of course, but it's different. No bamboo or other wooden accents. It's also on the small side, so be prepared. And no book of menu items, it's very short. You also have sushi and some Vietnamese selections - so there are not too many Thai selections.  What you will find are some well-presented items, and they are fresh and tasty. Service is good and the staff is friendly. They are perhaps a tad slower than other places, but it's not horrible. Worth a visit, but not quite sure if they would be in my regular rotation just yet.

FRWS3JO2_VJuDVouUmjjpw.text: Deduction for some slow service but the food was exceptional. The 3 star heat was plenty for me and I enjoy spicy food. Healthy portion sizes and good prices on Sake.

MZZQU61Qq__s5tdrfoVD7Q.text: Excellent meal.  You must try the sausage appetizer.  Truly delicious.  The Pho was phenomenal and Shaken Beef just wonderful.  Atmosphere was great and service was friendly and prompt.  Good choice for dinner!  If you like cocktails we recommend the cucumber crush.

6pDoXyfC_t11yz_xT-wSnA.text: shrimp tempura roll was soooo bad, shrimp was over cooked and there was barely any rice on the roll.

B_PFjcfDyk89yLg846fgQg.text: Terrible experience. I ordered a MILD drunken noodles, through post mates, which everyone knows typically is not spicy at all but I was given a crazy spicy dish. I actually enjoy spicy food and order Thai frequently but on the advice from someone who had previously ordered from this place that this dish is inappropriately spicy I went with MILD instead of medium which is what I typically enjoy. When I called to speak with someone I was told by the girl that answered that the manager would call me back. I never got a call back. When I called again 30 minutes later I was told that it is not their fault that the food is extremely spicy rather it was postmates fault and that I would have to talk directly to postmates as if they were the ones who prepared the food. Very rude. BEWARE of ordering from this place!

aAE3h2eAS4CdaN3PUQ29LQ.text: I ordered a chicken fried rice. I added extra egg and was charged close to $17. When I got home and began to eat it is literally chicken and rice! No veggies! This seems extremely over priced for chicken and rice in a bowl.

q2A35v2Cu_-mowiOcOHrGA.text: Really interesting menu with a Thai slant.  All the usuals and some more unusuals well; like, oyster pancakes.  Everything is delicious.  We've tried most of the menu and enjoyed it all.  Very attentive and friendly bartenders.

WO2R9bHmhLUP78_zCjKyEg.text: Very disappointing. I never ever give bad reviews but the staff really handled my issue very poorly. I clearly didn't like my dish. It was supposed to be "sort of like an oyster omelette" as the waitress tried to describe the dish to me. She said "I like it". As the staff could see me picking at it, I was asked by 3 servers if everything was ok, I finally told the 3rd person it wasn't and that i would have appreciated it if the waitress advised me that the dish was oily and deep fried. She responded that it is not deep fried and she asked if I would return, I said not. She offered to give me a discount. I only ate the mung beans in the dish and had to return to work hungry. She took off 10% so i got off $1.20. That was insulting and not a proper corrective action. I will not return. When my waitress gave me change she noticed my dish picked at and said nothing...My stomach hurts now.

iUqH0IwtHIavB76uXU4hoA.text: A co-worker and I ordered Rai Lay through Postmates and couldn't have been happier! She ordered the shrimp pad Thai and I had the drunken noodles. Both were great - I tried some of the pad Thai too. I asked for spicy and it sure was spicy but I loved it. Definitely going to try this out in person.

gFrEZjrT1O5LCHNXiBL6Ug.text: Food is most definitely great! Menu is a little small and it can get a little spicy but just ask your server for the best recommended item! Already tried the fried rice, and drunken noodles as well as spicy basil and shaking beef almost the entire menu and all delicious! For a Thai restaurant they do offer sushi which is pretty fresh. Been going here for awhile and definitely a plus! Drinks about average price and definitely well lit for the atmosphere whether it's lunch or dinner!

RCM1QAdjiW03vnk0U4dL6g.text: Great spot. Small and discrete. Crab fried rice I didn't eat but my friend said she didn't get crab meat vibes, I think it's because of the presentation of the crab. We ordered pork scewers (great), bon mi which was good but not served on a sticky bun but a toasted roll (totally cheated), to California rolls were fresh, I had the pad Thai (delicious). I enjoyed it. Good service. Rated 4 because they shouldn't call the pork sandwich bon mi if it's not on a traditional sticky bun.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai chicken

In78tsTOd27Qan8XCOvzJg.text: Not worth coming unless Pooh is working. First experience...awesome. Second...won't be coming back.  I ordered an Basil Chicken, which is supposed to come with edamame while you wait for your meal to be prepared. about 20 minutes after I ordered, a lady who wasn't my server came to my table with the meal. Confused, I asked why my edamame didn't come out before the meal. She shrugged it off and didn't ask if I needed anything else. (a spoon for the rice and soy sauce would have been my answer.) 10-15 minutes or so later my server comes back to check on me. Everything was fine...except for the nearly empty glass of water that needed to be refilled. I'm eating a very spicy dish...why wouldn't you refill my water? It takes literally 6 seconds. About 20 minutes before I needed to be back for work I was looking around the restaurant for my server to bring the check. I waited 15 minutes before some other man came to ask if everything was OK. I told him I had been waiting too long for my check so he went to get it. My server eventually came to my table but by then the other man had already taken my card for payment. The now-empty glass of water was still in plain sight to her.  HORRIBLE service, no offer to make me a happy guest regarding the wait time or edamame. NEVER COMING BACK!

dQ64B2Kw3DJEX0MRDcF5XQ.text: Ordered the basil chicken but substituted shrimp. Was really good! Also ordered a glass of 'New Age White Blend' that 4 friends and I enjoyed very much!

2xa4EppAWj_Um1bf_klneQ.text: Rai Lay offers dishes you won't find at your typical Thai spot. Spice levels are also spicier than you'd expect. For the papaya salad, we got a spicy 1 on a scale of 1 to 5 and it left our tongues tingling and our mouths thirsting for water. The Tom Yum noodles veered on the salty side, as with other dishes, but this place is still great for real Thai fare.

ykFLQFNbVyce_WMhHQsBGw.text: Unexpected find!!! I go to school by this place and it has become my favorite lunch place. Great food!! Decent prices!!

sNbNdrl5jRz1P4KaCtcZZw.text: Super cute inside and very cozy for a nice date! The veggie lovers was really great and I added some plump shrimp for some healthy protein. Great stop to check out!

_Xa8ki9TI7-H5F3GndrDbQ.text: I felt like getting some take out the other night while on my commute home.  I was driving so I couldn't look at the menu, and Ivy, who answered the phone,  was so kind to entertain my questions and tell me about some dishes.  I ordered the Pad Thai with Shrimp only and she suggested the Shaking Beef for my boyfriend.  Both dishes were excellent.  We had a great first impression that left us wanting to go back.

Wqw2KQ9LHoB4wABVKVYI1Q.text: Whoa! This place is amazing!!  My original goal was to go to Futo Buta but the line was crazy so my friend suggested Rai Lay and oh man, what a great place it way! First, no wait. At all!   And the food...wow! I got basil chicken, spicy! And it was everything I every wanted.   Also, definitely get their chili edamame. Service and atmosphere was great. Will be going back!

a6sOJI9gIKp75cyJu0WFSQ.text: I want to like this place. It's cute inside and ofter alot of traditional dishes. I order a drunken noodles with shrimp 4 level spicy. Yes it's spicy. The favor of the dish is off the noodles are not the thick fresh noodles they used the dry noodles so the favor aren't soaking in.  It's salty and sweet even weird. I'm sure shrimp cost more but for 14+tax you would think you will get more than five shrimps. Well im sorry but the drunken noodle was so confusing.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Too much sauce
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. It was saucy maybe thats why is salty

fdquRQqTGU7mFAqz6z6AhQ.text: So happy there's a Thai place in the Southend. And it was so good. We got Pad Thai, it was a little 'saucey' compared to Thai Taste in Dilworth. Both good in different ways. We also tried the basil chicken with white rice. So good. Inside is small and contemporary. The music was a bit trendy, kinda EDM, but it worked. Waitstaff was friendly and prompt. We'll be back.

AJrGfBPs3By6ZogwuHqeSA.text: We ordered Basil Chicken ,Shaking Beef and Spring Rolls To Go everything was great   If takeout is this good I can only imagine how amazing the food is dining in.  Welcome to the neighborhood!

LE5mfBlDN-rRBZglW18hJw.text: I've been dying to try this place. Heard so many great things ! Small restaurant in the south end.  Great start when they gave us a bottle of Prosecco for a discount when we told them it was national Prosecco day ! So we got two bottles.  Ordered the chicken tom yum soup , told them I wanted it spicy.  It was the best I've ever had, just the right amount of spice and so many flavors, lemongrass and cilantro, absolutely delicious. My two friends ordered the Kao Soy, which was so good, like a soupy yellow curry. Full of noodles, veggies and whatever protein you want. And plenty for leftovers. Will most definitely be back here, just wish it was open Monday's !

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Tom yum soup

PLo4ldsW9-B0xqPj8s09Qg.text: Charlotte's best Thai restaurant. Lao-style papaya salad is available and hits the spot. Heat and funk levels can get legit here, especially once they know that's what you want. That said, the Pad Thai is also the best I've had. Ask for fresh chopped chilis if you want to kick up the heat even more - great stuff!   Only complaint would be they don't rotate the specials very often - there are a few great ones I've had like green peppercorn chicken, and the chef has made a couple other random off-menu items upon request. More of this for the local Thai enthusiasts please!   Also the free rotating soup at lunch is a nice touch.

mnD2jpexEpy_SXK3ZAxlQg.text: Yaay- Its Thai Food below the mason dixon. I searched and searched for good Thai food for a few months after I initially moved to CLT. I was not happy with initial searches and decided I would wait till back in NYC before seeking Thai food.   I was wrong. IDK when Rai Lay Thai opened but I'm so happy they did.   The atmosphere is perfect. you can tell your close to the restaurant because the scent and smells are beckoning. Yummy!!! the menu is small and light and the staff is uber friendly.   The space is small and extremely cozy- which reminds me of tasty thai joints up north.  The Thai ice tea was tasty and refreshing and I think this location is definitely adorable for a casual date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States

7VcZHtWeYZJ1zH9fWJ8Wdw.text: Not the best Thai food Ive had. It encapsulates American Thai cuisine. Every dish fell flat and didnt have depth or richness that is indicative of traditional Thai cuisine.

KnfvpH89aB3f4kT_Vz55WQ.text: Ok I've tried this place twice and I'm a HUGE FAN!  It's been a while since I've found a Thai spot that I really enjoy, and makes good food. A coworker introduced me to RaiLai for lunch and I'm so glad he did.  Walking in, it's a small place but fits a lot of people. Most of the seating is seat for two guests but tables are moveable. They also provide a pretty large sushi bar, again for the size of the restaurant.   They have a great sushi offer during lunch hours, but one get one free. So make sure you order sushi and your entree! My suggestion for the perfect entree is the KAO SOY! Trust me you won't be disappointed. It's so flavorful everything you would want in a great Thai dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. KAO Soy

O0f5EwD7FL8Ss9q33ecRzA.text: Came here for drinks and appetizers last night. They have a small bar area that seats 6-7 people so that's where I headed to meet my friend.   I decided on the Pain Killer Saketini and my friend wanted the Classic Saketini with a ginger garnish. Well they were out of some of the ingredients so I had to change my drink choice to the Lycheetini and my friend had to go with the cucumber garnish instead. The drinks were ok.   We also tried the chicken larb (lettuce wraps). Also ok.   It seemed like there were a good amount of customers and to go orders around the dinner hour.   I'm still scratching my head about this...There is a front door on South Blvd that is chained shut with a sign that says to enter through the side door. You have to walk down a few steps to get to the dining area. There is a sign posted at the steps that says not handicapped accessible--please enter through front door.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Classic saketini. They were out of fresh ginger for the garnish
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cocktail menu. They were out of several of the flavored vodkas so we were limited in what we could order
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken larb

uLdrXhPgDEn9kHqdR7nMVA.text: I put off going to this restaurant for months. I finally found my way there on Easter Sunday and I am not disappointed. The restaurant is small and cozy. The atmosphere is casual. The food was so good that we ended up returning with the whole family ro celebrate a birthday a few days later.   I started my meal with pork gyoza and Thai chicken wings. The sauces in this spot are the key to life. The gyoza are perfectly seared and the sauce that accompanies them is perfect. I actually ended up swiping them through the left over sauce from the Thai wings as well. The Moo Ping is so flavorful. Tender marinated grilled pork strips in their Rai Lay sauce and served with sticky rice. Again, the sauce on this dish is incredible. DELICIOUS!!!   Next course we did the Kao Soy which I can best describe as a divine curry noodle soup. Similar to a laksa. When got the Kao Soy with shrimp and there was plenty of large be beautiful shrimp to be had. The curry flavor was authentic and full of depth. It was filled with noodles, cilantro, fried shallots, red onion, pickled mustard, limes and crispy noodles. I loved all the textures. We also had the shaking beef which is easily the best I've ever had and a unique fried rice. The portions are great and it was a perfect balance of colors, textures, aromas and flavors. The perfect meal!  The meal just got progressively better. Dessert was no exception. We ordered Thai crepes and molten lava cake. One of the cooks over heard is saying it was my son's birthday so he surprised us with an additional dessert. The Mango Sticky Rice, which ultimately was out favorite, but they were all delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai Crepe
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Panther Roll
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kao Soy

DCDlkATIgrmVlO9UiVwXyQ.text: On a hot summer day, a papaya salad and rainbow roll make the perfect refreshing meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rainbow roll and papaya salad

ezrHtXNqt-dAtDp8B1a5lw.text: We've tried so many of the restaurants in South End, but this was one of the few on my list we hadn't been to. We went last night after a happy hour and were very impressed.   It's a very small restaurant, but we were seated right away. The service was very good and our waiter was friendly.   We got there Spicy Basil and the Kao Soy (level 3 spice on both). Both were incredible. The Kao Soy came with a chili oil. I put about half of it in and mixed it up and it added a good amount of spice. The broth was so flavorful. The spicy basil was the perfect amount of spice. I loved that the chicken was more ground and acted kind of like a rice so I didn't really need to add rice to it.   I think this is the best Thai food in Charlotte. It's been flying a little under the radar. I hadn't heard a ton about it, but if you like Thai food, you should definitely check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Basil
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kao Soy

gJLehst5lAbCxx0GVxZwmA.text: This place is small, and has a nice atmosphere. Currently they cannot serve alcohol which is disappointing, and has been ongoing for over a month. It seems Deejai (also owned by them) is in the same predicament. So if you're looking for a date night, just know that going in.   The food is fantastic. Pad Prik and the Khao Soy are our go to items. The wings you can skip, get the spring rolls.

F5ceSw-_3ZZd8M1wcjodGA.text: Thai hot=# 5 spicy....whoa! They aren't playing with that. I ordered pad Thai #5 and it was super spicy...I mean...sweating, dying spicy. I love spicy food, but I think I will do a #3 next time. The flavor was delicious!!! I also tried the springs rolls and the moo ping. The moo ping was fantastic. It came with sticky rice that was so good. The spring rolls were also very yummy. The only sad thing was they were out of mangos for dessert. It broke my heart.  The waiter was nice, but a little slow and a little odd. The service wasn't bad or anything, but could've been better.   I'm anxious to come back and try the food just a smidge less spicy. I think it'll be way better.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Moo ping &amp; spring rolls
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sticky rice
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai

FcI-8r8U_sqRQDolydNmOw.text: I love spicy food. So I'm always in the hunt for something new with a nice level of heat. Rai Lay didn't let me down.  And I'm a fan.   For starters I tried the spring rolls and Moo ping. Both were good. Classic flavors and taste. I really enjoyed the sauces for both apps. For dinner, I ordered the Pad Prik at level 5 spicy. Normally, I get asked if I'm sure that I want it spicy (and I always have to smile and say yes I'm sure I like spicy). But that's didn't happen here. And I should have known that I leveled up. Rai Lay does level 5 spicy right. Guys, this dish was extra spicy goodness and I loved it!   The Pad Prik does an excellent job of blending some many flavors together and adding the extra spices just kicks it up. This dish was so good!   If you like your food spicy, this is your place! I'm looking forward to coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Prik
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Moo Ping

JBSwFC0wcK3zJTwIT8WjFg.text: This place is a hidden Gem.....small little spot, but so worth the find. I had the Shaking Beef and it was probably the best Thai food I've had in Charlotte. I also tried the Thai Chicken Wings (be warned if heat isn't your thing please as for no heat) the wings were yummy but spicy for my taste. My experience there was nothing short of Amazing! I love this place!!

6cM6Cumm7ClSM-CvkDPKDg.text: Amazing Thai food!  My friend is always talking about her past trip to Thailand and there's one specific dish she misses most and it's Khao Soy - also known as the nation's dish! I was born in Thailand but never heard of that before so I decided to try it.   The ambience is awesome. Clean facility, smiling host and friendly tentative wait staff. Customer service is good.   There were so many appetizers that I wanted to try. I love traditional Thai home cooked meals (I know, I know - my opinion is biased) and this place serves them all! Since I can't eat it all, we stuck with 1 app to share and an entree each. Warning - they serve a hot and sour soup before your meal arrives and it's delicious but very filling so go light on the free soup if you have a small appetite.   Papaya salad - I'm a papaya salad connoisseur. Seriously. Actually, I love any veggie salad made in the traditional Thai way - pounded in a mortar and pestle and extra spicy! This place hit the spot. I asked for the salad to be Lao style cause I love the umami of the sauce and they served it just right. It was super spicy, loads of flavor and most importantly, they added salted baby crabs and plenty of lime wedges. It was so good!   My friend ordered the national dish and I tried hers since I didn't want to commit - it's not for me. She LOVED it! Basically ate the entire bowl. To me, it was amped up curry soup with egg noodles. Too rich and thick for my liking but that doesn't mean the dish wasn't good - I just found that I don't care for khao soy.   My entree was lard na which is stir fried noodles and veggies in a thick gravy - and that was PERFECT! It was so good. There's a slightly sweet soy sauce flavor that coated every meat, veggie and noodle strand. I slurped it all up!   We ended our meal with Thai teas to go - another warning, it'll turn your tongue a weird orange color. But we'll worth it!   The hubs is jealous that I went without him. That just means I have to go back with him. No complaints about that! I'm definitely gonna try their other apps.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Papaya salad - look at all that juicy crab pieces and lime wedges. Mouth watering!
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Khao Soy - Thailand&#39;s national dish
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lard nar- get it. You&#39;re welcome.

yKQ4mxzbc0z5l2rGIKRPMA.text: I've been here before but this time was a memorable experience. We came into an almost empty restaurant. It's Saturday and right before the rush so it was perfect. Right after we were seated the flood gates opened, lol.   We ordered the wings as an appetizer, pad Thai and drunken noodles. The wings came right out. We then noticed our meal was taking a long time. During that time everyone around us got their food, even a group that walked in well after we had our wings. One couple even noticed and said "it'll be next." I laughed and said "y'all will get yours before ours". Sure enough theirs came out next. At this point we are furious but remained calm. My husband spoke with the waiter and he said it was coming right out. Won't waste anymore of your time but after 45minutes we finally got our food.   The waiter was very apologetic, almost uncomfortable but he felt really bad. We asked to speak with a manager, there wasn't one available and not even one on duty, hmmmm. They ended up "speaking with the manager" and were able to give us 50% off.   All in all, our food was delicious and the waiter was decent so that's why I gave more than 1 star. Maybe we will try again, maybe we won't.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States

XDT8Z9m48TE52J4-w6Fy2A.text: Favorite place to get Thai in CLT. Portions are large so there will be plenty to take home. Food is fast and service is great!!

nMB4vWAY-fAwTPc5wxtynw.text: Wow.  I love love love Thai food, and therefore, I love love love Rai Lay.  My bf and I came on Sunday for an early dinner (before we headed off to Whitewater Center). We ordered 1 Thai Iced Tea, Spring Rolls, Pad Thai - Tofu (for me), and Spicy Basil - Chicken (for my bf). Everything was AMAZING.   I was so stuffed by the time my Pad Thai came out, that I barely finished it. I had to pack it to go. Thai Iced Tea was one of my faves thus far, and I will always forgo alcoholic drinks at Rai Lay if this is available.  I can't wait to be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai iced tea
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring rolls
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai tofu

QBogI3yPjm80iForQZwzhw.text: Cozy spot, limited seating, making reservations if possible or expect a wait, especially if you go during the dinner rush or weekends. The grub is always sublime I think my favorite item on the menu has to be the Drunken noodles ( vegetables) the sauce is amazing! This would be a great spot for a casual evening out with friends or a 2nd date. Don't think it's good for families only because of limited seating might make kids a little anxious to explore. Limited street parking but there's a garage a half a block down with more parking available.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry of the day ( tofu )

OnViQ6o2O7WE54Pome1P1g.text: TLDR: The food is traditional Thai and several other Asian dishes.the service is fast. The vibe is casual. I recommend the kao soy and the spicy basil. Best Thai in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy basil

RScIw2-HUxCcUcb0v_uu0g.text: I enjoy eating at Thai restaurants very much and I will definitely be coming back to Ray Lai. I ordered the Tsunami Roll and it had some really great flavor. I love just about any sushi roll that has cream cheese and is flash fried. The spicy crab on top really gave it a little bit of extra kick that definitely was an added bonus. My girlfriend ordered the Kao Soy and it was probably the best curry dish I have ever had. It was full of flavor, spices were well balanced, and the chicken incredibly tender. Definitely would recommend coming out to try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Basil

Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tsunami Roll

hwiZRq3_UGYdLwt2T2N21g.text: Best Thai in Charlotte! Make sure you ask for Howdy too as your server. She's sure to guide you through menu and I've always left extremely full and happy. I recommend it to anyone that comes to Charlotte that wants Thai!

f3OiIfPOHdpgLrm0XR6SWw.text: So delicious! One of the best meals I've had in a long time. The Kao soy was absolutely unbelievable. I highly recommend. Great happy hour specials until 7, great apps and great food! One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte!!!

IOsFfl2DF8qDQJyq0laxNQ.text: Very great customer service!! Ordered the kao soy but something else was placed so had to wait on my order but it was worth it and she comp my order which she didn't have to but a very sweet gesture.  My husband had the lad nar and it was the best we ever had.  Thai chicken wings were delicious and the Thai tea was the best I ever had.  The Thai here is very different it's more authentic than most place I go too and it's very worth the wait.

Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best lad nar I ever had!

yQ0bVCkXip58CaBbto02MQ.text: Delicious!!!! Kao soy was awesome! Will be going back for this again! Great service too

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States

2AwhhaMJB2HJ11yo2dL0GA.text: Amazing, authentic Thai! Chef Peter and the staff go above and beyond to ensure you are happy!!

aoNy7uGYsZD-kuSU2shHsw.text: Amazing drunken noodles! The spice level varies, though. Sometimes the 2 is just right, and sometimes it's bland. We've also gotten takeout from there. The quality was great, but the 2 wasn't spicy enough. I recommend asking for a side of the "spice".  Other than that the place is fab!

2PFBRTE_Nkk0xeOygV2UKw.text: I'm from out of town and decided to try this for a quick bite. I had the Kao Soy and my Mother had the chicken drunken noodles. We loved it! I ordered to go but the staff was wonderful while I waited. Definitely planning to come back. Thanks guys!

vCpYvfntWdAgTO1QheA6VA.text: I was blessed with the opportunity to live in Thailand for 6 months and I have missed the food ever since. Rai Lay fills that void with authentic, amazing Thai food. I have tried Thai in LA, Chicago, New York and Philly and this place is by far the best Thai food I have had in the US. Get the Khao Soi, you will leave happy and full.

4JrHrYsaAWWw6EakVeYrdg.text: Very good sushi. Service is great as well- pretty fast! Enter portion sizes are comparable to other Thai places in the area- enough for two servings. The prices are a dollar or so more than other Thai places in the area but the location, atmosphere and service is worth it.

Gr2dDNknUS8cHykUgyH-lA.text: I normally try to stay clear from writing bad reviews and debated on writing this. But I really did enjoy this place at one point and hope that they improve based on my experience that I encountered recently. I came in to eat on Friday the 13th (coincidence much ?) well my experience wasn't pleasant. Don't get me wrong the food was good. This isn't my first time at Rai Lay, as I do enjoy their spicy basil chicken and always find myself coming in when I'm craving Thai food. But this review is mainly for the staff. The host and waitstaff is friendly and sweet but my problem is with the sushi guy, bartender, management/ownership. I saw with my own eyes the sushi guy drinking alcohol on the job and seeing that just killed my whole experience. I know other people saw it as well and the workers were acting as if it was normal and as if they do this often. I mean is it normal to be drinking while working in the food industry ? If so then maybe it's just me who doesn't want to see it. I don't know if the whole staff is drinking on the job but seeing that really had me worried. I personally don't want to be served food by employees who are drunk or have been drinking on the job. The bartender is suppose to be in control of the alcohol so shame on her for giving her coworkers alcohol to drink. Also shame on the management and owners for not keeping an eye on their employees and allowing them to do this. I honestly used to love this place but after seeing that, it's changed my perspective completely. I do know that no restaurant is perfect as well and hopefully I'll find myself coming back once the problem is fixed. I don't want to give up on them just yet which is a good thing.

sQnlHCy22miHpa4S_nA4Gw.text: Big things come in small packages. This small restaurant serves amazingly flavorful dishes. Reasonable prices and large portions make this a must stop.

JbEulYxceh96wT2vLTRJNw.text: The Kao Soy was on my radar from fellow Yelp reviewers, and it did not disappoint! 4 of 7 of our dinner party had it and well all loved it. The flavors are complex and and the texture creamy. I enjoyed it with shrimp and lots of the chili served on the side. The portion was huge and I took half of it home, it reheated well and was just as good left over. We also had several of the appetizers during happy hour from 5 to 7, when they're all half off. We loved the spicy mu pork, edamame, crispy spring rolls, and beef jerky. Our server Howdy was also fabulous!

ZkgZ-sQ7VMAMXyfB2Tx0gA.text: Got the Spicy Basil Chicken and Kao Soy... one word, awesome. Great food, great service, and easy to find parking. Totally recommend.

QmLH273mfN8RQ-pwDvweGQ.text: WOW! Kao Soy is the way to go and is beyond deliciousness (a huge portion too). I was also able to try the Basil Chicken and Pad Thai and this was by far the winner in my eyes. The coconut broth soup they give you as a starter was tasty as well. Some of the best Thai I've had in Charlotte for sure! It does get a little busy so our lunch service was on the slower side, but go early and you'll be fine.

_OuP3IG0EuHAhr-lD8cGNA.text: Really enjoyed going here with my wife! She got the drunken noodles and I had the Kao Soy which was really good! The spicy oil on the side was great and gave me the chance to determine how spicy I really wanted it. It's a pretty small spot so I would recommend going in the early evening or seeing if you can snag a spot at the bar.

wqPOxbQkbTsE7J61hJAN7Q.text: Came here for the first time last night and the food was amazing! Started off with the medium spicy papaya salad with the fermented baby crabs added on and it was delicious! It wasn't too sweet or too spicy. My dinner entree was the chicken/tofu kao soy which had depths of flavor! If you're looking for some good Thai food around the area then definitely give this place a try! Great service, reasonable prices with considerable portions!

A-apSZLFadDG1nJJSMfGSg.text: Wonderful selection of Thai dishes and sushi, including Kai Soy, which is hard to find in the US

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Duck salad, yum!

5-lkLYlESiSLtRT8Zut_sQ.text: Love, love, love, this place. Always exceptionally tasteful, although the kitchen was backed up and we waited about 30 minutes for our food it was still enjoyable and once the food arrived it was delicious. Fortunately for them but unfortunately for us the secret is out.

iZZsBoSDKfbr0Z5NxdGD-A.text: Have gone twice so far, not a bad little spot. I have gone for dinner and lunch, both times the manager, Emily, is working incredibly hard. She really makes sure the customers are welcomed and everything is up to par.  Today at lunch they were short staffed and people were waiting a little while for a table. A host for lunch and dinner should be present, instead of the manager and servers finding the time to seat them.  Overall, good experience but they certainly need to do something about putting more employees on the floor.

iIcqAWbZbATN_mw8WLd-3g.text: Had an really nice time here tonight enjoyed the Drunken noodles with the 3 star spice and it had a delicious kick that left me wanting more! I ended off the meal with the lava cake and the ice cream on top gave me the sweet relief I need to top of the meal! Service was quick and friendly and Victoria was so helpful with deciding what to have this time! Defiantly great place to try something new each time!

mh2aRWdSqEa3avzEVeCn2A.text: Great spot! The Kao Soy is my favorite and comes in a huge bowl. The sauce is creamy and has a coconut curry flavor. The service is always great. There's also cheap appetizers on happy hour. Be sure to check your to go orders before leaving though, because we've gone home with the wrong dish.

lYl65Lfy_fTRLUy4EvuECw.text: Found this place on yelp and decided to try it for a date night. We walked in around 7:15 and were seated right away although the place is not huge. Tables are ver close to each other so we could hear people talking the whole time. Food and service is the highlight of this place. Our server Lei was so funny and great. I had thaitini ( hard thai tea) and tasted yummy. We got Basil thai chicken to share and it was just the right hot to hit the spot. Sushi was amazing, we had a shrimp tempura roll. I recommend if you go here for food and great service.

fp9HMf6nqPJ7Lqmojq9wiw.text: Amazing shrimp pd Thai and super calm and relaxing atmosphere. Would definitely go back and get the same thing! Had a glass of Prosecco and it was a nice pairing

vXwwsx1CHfhq4DrzocTB4g.text: A nice ambience asian fusion place that offers Thai, Vietnamese, and sushi! Have good drinks specials and a varieties of mixed drinks! I guess the night I came which is last Wednesday, they finalized their menu from the time they opened.  Greet by the hostess. Our server Noy was tentative, sweet and informative! My friend and I were excited to try a new Thai restaurant since our go to is Thai Taste!  Our dishes for the night: Shaking Beef(Vietnamese dish) very sweet saucy and meaty. Bestie likes it a lot. Chicken fried rice was really good. Tastes very fresh and light yet comforting! Then fried ground catfish with papaya salad. The salad was yummy but I'm very confused with the fried catfish. Very bland and dry.. Even mixing with the salad didn't help. I'll leave that alone even for next time for sure! Then the Panther Sushi. Nothing special about it at all.. I'm not impressed! Very pricey for what it is!  Now desert.. The lava chocolate cake. It's sooo good.. Tasted like the same cake from Lebowski's! We're sooo stuffed but we have to finish the cake!   Overall I think the items a little over priced. Especially the sushi when compared to soo many good sushi places around them. I'll save my money to go to Nikko's instead! But the other food are good. I wouldn't mind coming back for the fried rice, shaking beef and try other things on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. The noodles wasn&#39;t completely cook all the way.. and the menu didn&#39;t tell me what type of noodles. wouldn&#39;t have order it again.
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lava cake gone 5 mins later
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lava chocolate cake.. Soo yummy

VWjuOy9sUPzkZ8FWUUKkzw.text: Thought this place was pretty average. There were certain dishes that were good, and others that was a bit off. On the appetizers the thai sausage was really delicious. The thai wings and the spring rolls were ok. The thai wings tasted more like regular spicy honey bbq wings. The Paleo dish was very good. It was pork belly braised in a sweet soy sauce braising liquid along with a hard boiled egg. The sauce was great over some rice. We also ordered the shrimp drunken noodles. It was definitely way too salty and hard to swallow after a few bites. Portions were decent. Apps are expensive but entrees are average price. All bottles of wine were $20 saturday which was not too bad. This place was ok there are better thai reataurants in the area. Just need to tweak their sauces a bit.

B-DyRt1D_LRG6IzXJ6y3ig.text: I've been here several times for lunch with coworkers in the last 6 months. Although the food is good in terms of taste,  the portion is inconsistent and staff are not helpful, lame excuses ie the cook is different,  the owner changed the portion size, but it's never the same so go figure!   Also although the place is clean, it's very tight in there, not comfortable.   I put up with it because I really like their basil chicken!

fU0yn1Fm2MY8TXcQ-EMHRA.text: I had very high hopes for Rai Lay. So many southend people told me it was awesome. I got takeout the other night and there was some good and some not so good, which is why I'm giving them a 3 star rating.  Shaking beef-awesome. Just yummy. Good portion size.   Larb -tofu (like lettuce wraps) very odd flavor that wasn't enjoyed by my husband or I. And holy onions! Even if you love onions which my husband does, the whole darn dish was onions. Complete overkill.   Curry- they don't have specific dishes on the menu it's just curry of the day. When I called in the order I was told it came with mixed vegetables. Ok there was probably 2 red peppers sliced up and sauteed in there. I like peppers. But I'm used to and wanted something besides that in my curry dish. Where's the eggplant? The green beans? The potatoes? Skimpy on the chicken as well.  All in all it was a cute place. I'd maybe go back for the shaking beef. The staff at the register is very young and be cautious when they hand you your takeout bag because I got the wrong one and and am glad I caught it prior to leaving.

ITtKP4JN1620huJM1jcMjg.text: Have been plenty of times and they have good food. But will close earlier then what's advertised, so it was  a big disappointment when a few friends and I were turned away. When asked why they closed earlier then what was on the door, Oliver told us it was because the cooks went on break. So if you try to get in for some quick sushi in the last half hour I would call first to see if they've let the cooks go on break for the day.

eqju5EJ3Zj1IuRSFhIwOdA.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. We going down the road and passed the sign and said let's try this place. Best decision we ever made. We have been going here nearly weekly every since. The staff is excellent and will help you if have any questions about anything. The drinks are out of this world. My husband loves the shrimp fried rice and let me tell you it's real shrimp and it will change your life. The sushi will melt in your mouth like butter. Give this place a try so you to can fill the joy I do every time I go there

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte. I love the food here and the drinks are outstanding. We come just about every week

M78LGYO3hHAviGNnNQt3Mw.text: Just got into town and wanted good sushi or Thai food. After we stopped into another odd place a few blocks away that looked like an Asian fusion Buffalo Wild Wings-I will not name the name.....Found this little gem and the food and service was great. Will definitely be back.

l5F9agLir9xwHTihDcruyw.text: Really loved all of the food I tried here! It was one of the best fried rice dishes I've ever had! They put lovely garnishes on it as well. My friend ordered a spicy  dish and the waiter warned about how spicy it was. However, it came out with no spice at all. The dish was still good but a little disappointing. The prices are a little steep but my fried rice easily made two meals! They also had great happy hour specials (half off!). Can't wait to go back.

rd5XDwIacfDqSgZoJgz_XA.text: Really great pad Thai, fried rice was delish as well. I would Most definitely come back again. The young lady I was dining with is a complete train wreck but I didn't have any choice in the matter

5MHCdKoRCi-T9YQHnJpcrw.text: My boyfriend and I just tried this place. Our expectations were pretty high and let me tell you they were definitely met! I got the pad Thai and poke salad. It was delicious! The pad Thai wasn't to sweet or to spicy it was just right! The poke was fresh and tasted amazing! We also got a sake flight and the lychee sake was the best! I definitely reccomend it and ask for lay! She was our server and was great describing everything on the menu and giving great input on what we'd like!

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai. The best in charlotte
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Poke salad. Delicious!

GaPSPYO7EMmec6I8pm6G8g.text: Omg so good!! Quiet on a Saturday afternoon. Got a table right by the door. We ordered drinks and I found a new favorite, Moscow mule! The server talked a little too much, but she was friendly and excited about telling us what's good on the menu. We ordered an app of Moo Ping. Holy shit!!  Marinated pieces of tender pork shoulder on skewer and it comes with sticky rice and a dipping sauce that's sweet , salty, and savory. The sticky rice comes in a cool little  woven basket type thing and you break open the cellophane to get it out. You roll some rice into a ball, grab a piece of pork and dip into the sauce. That shit knocked me out!! Should've ordered ten of em!  I ordered Kao Soy because of what I heard. However, I'm not a curry lover and should've ordered something else. But, it was beautifully presented, came with a hot chili oil you can pour over and lime. I ordered mine with shrimp. It had such depth of flavor, but can only be enjoyed if you like curry. My friend had the chicken lo mein and that was delicious. Noodles perfectly cooked, great flavor, so good. Order the sticky rice dessert with mango and vanilla ice cream. Very interesting and delicious. They have places in 2 other locations. I'm definitely going back for the pork skewers. Yummo!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States

An6jvu_RxK0XFXyWxmA2Ig.text: Full disclosure: I have only had the crab fried rice (no onions) from here- but OMG it is one of my favorite dishes in all of charlotte. I have been probably 12-15 times now and the rest of the menu looks amazing- but I cannot bring myself to try anything else.   They do not skimp on the crab and it is full of flavor!The first time I got it 4 (out of 5) spicy and it was a little too much for me.  I am a big fan of spicy too.  I would say go at least 1 star less than you think just to be on the safe side.  Also, be prepared to eat it for days b/c they give you about 5 lbs in your order (my go to carryout for when the wife is out of town and I just eat it all weekend).   They do not skimp on the crab and it is full of flavor!

LtTGn2HaFQds0CkN1pqlVQ.text: I've been going past this restaurant for the past four months as it was getting ready to open. I was really excited to get another Asian option in Southend.   The room is bright and modern. We went for lunch and it got pretty busy. The service was good and everyone was friendly.   The food selections were good, there were some different dishes that I haven't seen in many places around Charlotte so that was exciting. Their curry dish was also better than average. Value wise I found it a little overpriced, especially their sushi... but I guess that's the upcharge for being in Southend. They do have specials daily to be sure to check those out.

uga2eE8AjoqcEgGuNJMopw.text: I just sat down for dinner and waited more than ten minutes for a server to come. After that wait I asked the host if there was actually a server that was working with the table she sat us at and she said yeah. However after waiting a couple more minutes without being acknowledged we decided to go somewhere else. I understand waiting if they were busy however they weren't just poor service overall.

r5IdY4tAKy_jmH1q4r0OVA.text: Was pretty surprised by this place. Small but nicely designed interior, cool bar, kind of an open kitchen deal. Was almost full when we got there at 7:30 on a Wednesday night. Waitress was awesome and they had a number of local brews on tap that I appreciated.   The food was great. I order chicken larb at every Thai restaurant I go to. This was the best I've ever had. Great fresh taste with the lime juice and fresh cilantro, some slices of fresh and tasty yellow tomato and cucumbers. A little salty but I ate the entire appetizer myself. We also ordered the spring rolls that I'm told were good but I was busy double fisting larb lettuce wraps and couldn't be bothered with them.   A previous review mentioned they had pad see yew even though it wasn't listed on the menu. We ordered that to split and it was equally delicious. Had a spicy/sweet combo that was nice, and veggies were still a little crisp and quite fresh. Entire meal was $40 with two beers. Great date night!  New favorite Thai restaurant in town. Highly recommend!

vTziTGIKPO_jMxOU3S6LdA.text: I'm in town for work and have had really great luck with food in Charlotte, but unfortunately this place fell flat for me. I ordered the pad Thai for a comfort food treat, and if I didn't place the order I probably wouldn't have recognized that's what it was. Maybe it was my mistake to add veggies instead of tofu, but there was definitely an absence of sprouts, peanuts, and the green onions looked extremely dark and wilted.

9eRG_iyGmf9TIZuzrKItuA.text: This is my new favorite Thai place and one of the best Thai meals I've had to date.  The places is a little small but did not bother me at all. They also have very cool and unique light fixtures, loved the ambiance. The service was also very attentive. I have now tried the Kao Soy, Palo, Moo Ping, Shaking Beef, and the Whole Snapper. They are all very delicious. This place is different than your normal Thai place but that's why I love it.  Venture outside of your box and try something you haven't had or may have never even heard of before. One of my good friends taught English in Thailand and Kao Soy was his favorite dish there. I was very excited to try it when I heard this place had it, it did not disappoint, and now one of my favorite Thai dishes that I have ever had.   I am looking forward to going back and trying more options on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kao Soy - curry noodles, chicken, limes, fried shallots, bean sprouts, cilantro, &amp; fresh red onion topped with crispy noodles
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Palo - Pork served in a sweetly spiced soy broth

IfNHQMtxgT8Pz4wog2NKog.text: Ok. At this moment this might be my new favorite place. Generous portions and half price sake on Sunday didn't hurt. Thai basil beef fantastic. I asked for 4 out of 5 spice, and they delivered. Snapper trio could feed three. And nice spice too. Try it out.

zKLf_2bvWtlrGo05ydBMQQ.text: I've been waiting for this place to open! FINALLY! We walked in today for lunch to find a packed Rai Lay. It's much smaller than I expected, a little cramped as far as seating goes. It's a very trendy/modern place, the EDM never stopped and the decor was not average of a Thai place. Our server was quick to pour us water and take out order. The salted edamame was nice to munch on while we waited. I ordered the Kao Soy because who doesn't love curry noodles and the bf ordered the basil chicken spice level 3. It can get a little pricey for lunch, my noodle dish was $14 but fairly large for a lunch portion.   We found the basil chicken had good flavor but it was extremely spicy for a level 3! I feel like Rai Lay's level 3 is a 4-5 in reality. Order a Thai iced tea if you order anything over a spice level 2. This is the first time I've seen ground chicken in this dish also. The Kao Soy was da bomb! I loved the curry gravy here, the coconut based curry was both sweet and spicy. The fried noodles on top gave nice crunch and the overall presentation was beautiful. I would definitely get the Kao Soy again. At our neighboring table, a fellow dinee got the oyster pancakes, that will be my next victim.. It smelled heavenly.   I couldn't finish the Kao Soy so I had to take it home. A suggestion for soupy dishes, please consider closed plastic containers in stead of the styrofoam box... I had to drive home slow to make sure the car wasn't detailed with my leftovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch chicken fried rice
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kao Soy $14
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kao Soy $14

id_TEBXRDPRWA3D2z9JhTQ.text: This is by far the best Thai food restaurant I've ever had. Their ingredients are locally grown and everything is so fresh! Oliver was our server and he was great and very attentive. Highly recommend this place.

DpKcTQwennOWXz3Q2ssNng.text: Everything I ordered was amazing! Chicken Tom Ka Chicken wings  Shrimp tempura roll with asparagus! Will definitely come again  Hornets nest is a great light wheat beer.  The restaurant setup is comfy. It's tight in here but still a great spot.

EMDky_p5co5a-O9aAf0Frw.text: Thai food is certainly one of my guilty pleasures.  I really only trust the Thai restaurants where the decorations look like they were shipped straight from Thailand and the owner's mom is in the back making spring rolls.  It's not typically someplace I would go on a Friday with friends before heading out for a night on the town, but you can always trust it for a casual dine-in or take-out dinner any day of the week.  Rai Lay completely takes that concept and tosses it out the window.  I walked in on a Sunday night with a friend thinking "ok, let's try something new.  If it's bad, we'll go for pizza after."  Well, no need for pizza.  We walked in and the place had a cool vibe/atmosphere to it.  Definitely a place I would go with friends before going out or on a date.  The place is small and doesn't have a ton of tables, so I can only imagine the wait when this place starts getting busy.  The drinks were hit and miss...I think they are still working on some recipes.  The Sweet Tea Mojito was a big fail, while the Sakerita was a huge hit.  Tasted awesome and you can get it with either a sugar or salt rim dusted with sriracha.  Also, good to know that they have $3 Mimosas on Sunday...I would expect nothing less than a mimosa special on a weekend.  Saving the best for last...the food.  First, they came around with a little sushi sample.  I didn't try it because I don't like fish, but it looked beautify.  We ordered the Fried Spring Rolls, which were good and not greasy at all.  We also destroyed the Basil Chicken and Pad Thai.  Both were excellent and the restaurant accommodated our request for ingredient substitutions.  Warning though on the basil chicken...it's ground chicken and not chunks.  If you haven't tried it with ground chicken, it was great and flavorful.  So yeah, I'll be back.  I went there less than 24 hours ago and have already recommended it to two people.  Staff is very friendly and wants your feedback, so if you love/hate something, let them know!

photos.caption: Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet tea mojito and a sakerita w/sugar and Siracha rim!
Photo of Rai Lay Thai - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cute table setup with mason jar water glasses

tMTlcgbz0NerS79cF_E_dA.text: I really wanted to give this place 5 stars because their food is amazing, but my roommate and I have found hairs in our food on 3 separate occasions. She found one in her rice twice, and I just found one in my pad Thai last night. It's pretty disgusting to have that happen 3 times. Unfortunately I won't be coming back here anymore!

IuebJ3eu6y7-OCmEGEFKlw.text: A must eat in downtown Charlotte. The food is so well seasoned! It has been a long tim since the i had food  with such good flavor. It's a small little restaurant with a powerful flavor. Will come back for sure

G7Ll_8DCHbzKoBsz4hknfA.text: Visited this place for after two days in a row; yes it was that amazing. Alaina was the bartender and she was super friendly and fabulous. I tried several different cocktails and they all were amazing, especially the Saki-Rita. YUM!  My 2nd visit there I stuck with the Saki-Rita's as a drink of choice but I also tried the fried rice. It was delicious

5ikJQ34t7TvfBSjEO68ZVg.text: The ambiance was fun blending metal and wood!!  Our waitress was really nice,  super informative,  and really good!   We Ordered the..  Fried Spring Rolls $6 Cabbage, carrots, & noodles served with sweet chili sauce & ground peanuts  Whole Snapper Fried whole snapper served with steamed rice & our spicy dipping sauce  Veggie Lover ( Pad Pak) $14 Seasonal veggies mixed in stir-fry sauce, served with steamed rice  Gin- a- tonic   The spring rolls were not that good & the sauce was spicy and not for my taste. They had a spicy mayonnaise that wasn't spicy, but made them slightly better.  My friend said the snapper was incredible! I got the Veggie Lover with only zucchini and onion.  The sauce was nice and it was decent. The rice was cooked perfectly. The prices here are high for the quality of what you get.  This won't become a regular.

EG_RsTx6PPhOgnzuPJsEig.text: Absolutely delicious! I had the Kao Soy as recommended by my amazing server Lexi. She also recommended some dishes for my Mom and boyfriend, which they absolutely loved and exactly what they asked for. The soup was just the right amount of spice, so flavorful with shrimp, and a good serving size. I got sat right away and the environment was bustling. I definitely recommend!

29oVyAnMk1L2KbDgVF0Aag.text: They do their spices right in this location. Coming back for sure. Their servers are really nice. They have me extra rice and kept coming back with water. Can't beat that.

b8ODjdPv5zyT5ZhEwgGxEw.text: Excellent place!! My friend and I came here on a Saturday for a pretty early dinner. We got the moo ping as a appetizer which was really really good! It was flavorful and the sticky rice compliment it well. Then we got the classic Kao Soy and pad see ew which was really good as well. The portion sizes were big and we even had leftovers to take home. Thai ice tea was authentic and you could tell it was made in house.   We didn't know that there was happy hour from 5-7pm until our host came and told us but by that time we were already full. The appetizers were half off so I'll definitely be back for that!    Overall a great place for some Thai food! The place was clean, food was good, and service was fast!

a_LpskCPvIsHDHUkDjf5fg.text: This was not what I would consider Thai. At best, maybe asian fusion.  It was missing a lot of my favorites like tom yum, satay, and pad see ew. Got the beef jerky and spring rolls for apps. The jerky was like they took some bagged jerky and tossed it in a frying pan. The spring rolls tasted like it was just shredded cabbage wrapped in a spring roll wrap, served with jarred duck sauce (no way it resembled thai sweet chili sauce). Husband had the spicy basil, and I had panang curry.  Both seemed kind of 2-dimensional, like they were missing something.  Will not be coming back.

8K_MjuiXlURGpOpfoJMnKQ.text: This place has the best Thai I have had ever had. I got the Pad Prik a few appetizers, Thai wings were awesome!! Everything from service to food were A+++++. It gets 10 Stars from me! My new favorite Thai place

F3VxJrlmi7Iue66Ej1qIqA.text: All the servers are amazing, but if you end up with Howdy, you're lucky...she's awesome!

cNT_oJaf9U1SeuP94x-Q2w.text: Excellent Thai spot close to downtown Charlotte. Stopped in for a quick dinner before heading back to school after Fall Break. We usually go to Thai Taste but had to branch out since it's closed on Sundays. Rai Lay had good reviews according to the Charlotte Agenda, so we gave it a try. Boy are we glad we did! The Pad Thai was out of this world! I had the tofu and it was very good. Better than Thai Taste, I dare say! 10/10 - will definitely be returning. Be sure to check out Rai Lay when you're in the mood for some delicious Thai.

SFRDbOqiMzUlGYI_urILpA.text: Had dinner here for the first time tonight. The food was delicious. Spicy and flavorful. Lots to eat i had leftovers for the next day. The real highlight was the service we had Shannon as our server. Best service I have had in years, attentive, knowledgeable and friendly the food was worth the visit the service means this is now my go to Thai restaurant in Charlotte.

bWiyS4tP7jiCSrtXbO7_NQ.text: Visited for the first time this past Friday. We had yellow curry and grilled pork, it was amazing! Our server, Howie, was just the best! She convinced my toddler to try new foods, and was super attentive and engaging. We can't wait to come back and try new things, and we will definitely request to be at Howie's table! Five star food, five star service!

YBTV1c6r6Gd_YTe_wJxeXw.text: I love thai food!! I stumbled across this place. I came in to order some food to go for lunch. I got the drunken noodles aka pad kee mao. I got the lunch portion with chicken. It was labeled a spice level 3. I told the girl I love spicy food and asked if I should get it into a 4 or 5 and she told me no since it was so spicy. It was not spicy enough for me. The noodles were cooked ok but they were all sticking together. I'm taking about 3 big clumps of noodles. It was really hard to separate and since they were all sticking together, there wasn't enough sauce. Most of the onions in the dish were good but they forgot to cut the outer layer of the onion so it was super chewy. Overall, the place was good. I'm gonna try their sushi next time.

3eHZaXTOReFezCocywQmhw.text: Delicious food! I recommend the kao soi, especially if it's served by the lovely Oliver.
